title: Like Judd Apatow, after writing a screenplay, if I want to make it into a movie myself, what is the process to make it? - Quora

response.answer_text: Long, complex and expensive. One person cannot make a full length feature movie, except to put it on YouTube and show friends. You are much better off selling your screenplay to a production company or studio. They will know how to… Read your script and assign a budget for every department - set design, lighting, costume, hair, make-up, catering, location scouting, line producers, catering, transportation, practical effects, armourer, post production, CGI effects, grading, sound mixing, music, editing, ADR, marketing, distribution and of course cast.Actually raise the money to pay all of the people who will do the foregoing.Have relationships with casting directors who can find the right actors for your budget.Appoint heads of department under (almost) all the previously-mentioned categoriesHire, buy or build all of the lights, cameras, sound recording gear, props, sets, costumes, vehicles, and anything else your movie requiresPlan and execute the shooting of your movie, including finding locations, obtaining permissions, transporting your cast and crew, feeding and housing everyone, planning the schedule, ensuring it is stuck to, making contingency plans, dealing with the unexpected.Plan and execute the post-production of your movie, including editing, grading, effects shots, ADR, sound mixing, music composition, and foley.Organise test screenings, followed by re-editing, re-recording, re-shooting as necessaryActually have some way of releasing the finished product so people can see it, download it, or rent it and some way of making sure people know it exists.Feel intimidated yet? You should. Making a movie is hard. It takes a team of experienced professionals. You don’t do it in your bedroom (and expect anyone to want to watch it who isn’t related to you).
